page.title: 17JOBS ON THE STUD FARMS
page.content: We talked to Mr Cazenave who works on White Lodge Stud Farm. He said he gets up at 7.30 and gets the mares and foals out to feed them. They are fed on staminoats-a mix of fish guts, barley and oats. At 9am he goes for breakfast and then puts hay in the stables. The horses are put in paddocks, and go back in the stables at 5pm. He has lunch at 2pm, and spends the afternoon doing odd jobs, like cutting the hedges. He finishes at 5pm. Mr Kinsey is the stud groom. He gets up at 7.30 and goes to a stud in Woodditton to see that everything is all right. Then he goes back to White Lodge and opens the mail. He has his breakfast at 9am, and at 9.30 goes round the stud to check everything is all right. At 11am he has coffee and after lunch he helps Mr Cazenave.
